advjava.assessment1.zuul.refactored.character

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • advjava.assessment1.zuul.refactored.character.Character
      • advjava.assessment1.zuul.refactored.character.Player

  • public class Player
extends Character
    The player class represents the current player(s) and stores all information about them. Extending functionality from Character superclass, it offers little on top aside a few methods.
    Author:
    dja33

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String name, Room startingRoom)
      Third Constructor for creating a player, assumes DEFAULT_MAX_WEIGHT an empty inventory, and no description
      Player(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, Room startingRoom)
      Secondary Constructor for creating a player, assumes DEFAULT_MAX_WEIGHT and an empty inventory
      Player(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, Room startingRoom, java.util.List<Item> items, int maxWeight)
      Default Constructor for creating a player, provides functionality to completely design player on parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String description,
              Room startingRoom,
              java.util.List<Item> items,
              int maxWeight)
       throws InvalidCharacterNamingException
        Default Constructor for creating a player, provides functionality to completely design player on parameters. Passing a maxWeight <= 0 will establish the DEFAULT_MAX_WEIGHT for the player instead.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the Player
        description - Description of the player
        startingRoom - The Starting Room for the player
        items - The starting inventory for the player
        maxWeight - The Maximum weight for the player
        Throws:
        InvalidCharacterNamingException - The name of the player cannot be null or an empty String

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String description,
              Room startingRoom)
       throws InvalidCharacterNamingException
        Secondary Constructor for creating a player, assumes DEFAULT_MAX_WEIGHT and an empty inventory
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the Player
        description - Description of the player
        startingRoom - The Starting Room for the player
        Throws:
        InvalidCharacterNamingException - The name of the player cannot be null or an empty String

       throws InvalidCharacterNamingException
        Third Constructor for creating a player, assumes DEFAULT_MAX_WEIGHT an empty inventory, and no description
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the Player
        startingRoom - The Starting Room for the player
        Throws:
